The estimated cost of the ARC Tunnel pro: The claim states that the project was originally estimated to be $8.7 billion. This aspect was verified by federal officials who confirmed the initial estimated budget.
Responsibility for cost overruns: The claim suggests that New Jersey alone would have been responsible for covering any additional costs beyond the $8.7 billion budget. This aspect was verified by a spokesperson from the U.S. Department of Transportation, who confirmed that based on federal rules, New Jersey would indeed be responsible for cost increases.
Contributions from different sources: The claim mentions that the project was backed by billions of dollars from federal and state sources. This aspect was verified by stating that New Jersey was set to contribute $2.7 billion, the Port Authority of New York and New Jersey was set to contribute $3 billion, and the remaining $3 billion was expected to come from a federal transit program.
Potential increase in project cost: The claim highlights that federal officials estimated the cost of the project could climb to between $10 billion and $13 billion. This aspect was verified by mentioning that federal officials presented options to fund the remaining costs, including federal loans and a public-private partnership, as the cost was projected to increase to around $9.8 billion to $12.4 billion.
